text: Searching family photos, news stories, "personal news" and scams that fill our social media accounts are not for the weak, or for people who try to reduce time on the screen. Among the updates from friends and hots from intellectuals, there are often dark warnings, sparking fear, and it's just, well, wrong. "There's news from the police," reads one of these articles from Facebook from January 9. "It's an urgent message for all. In the next few weeks, please don't drink any PEPSI product like Pepsi, Tropicana juice, Place, 7up, etc. A worker from the company admitted that he had added his blood contaminated with AIDS. Watch MDTV. He was on the sky news channel yesterday. Please come forward and warn others as well." This article was referred to as part of Facebook's efforts to combat false news and misleading information in its news broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.)
